get.description: List all apps in the organization

id.description: The id of the app.

projectId.description: The id of the project the app belongs to.

createdAt.description: The date and time the app was created.

updatedAt.description: The date and time the app was updated.

latestVersion.description: The version string of the latest version of the app.

inputSchema.description: The input schema of the app.

outputSchema.description: The output schema of the app.

related.description: The url of the latest version.

first.description: The url of the first page of results.

last.description: The url of the last page of results.

next.description: The url of the next page of results.

prev.description: The url of the previous page of results.

post.summary: Start a run for an app
post.description: Starts a new run for a released app. Once the run has started you can stream the run using the stream url contained in the response under `links.stream`. You can also poll the run for updates using the url contained in `links.self` or the `describeRun` endpoint.

schema.description: The time zone to use for the run as a valid IANA time zone

parameters.description: The time zone to use for the run as a valid IANA time zone
parameters.name: Time-Zone

version.description: The version of the app to run as a semver string. If not provided, the latest version will be used.

url.description: The url to send the webhook to.

webhooks.description: A list of urls to be notified when the run starts, updates, and completes.

id.description: The id of the run.

version.description: The version of the app that was run. When using a semver range or 'latest', this will be the highest version that matches the range.

status.description: The status of the run.

url.description: The url to send the webhook to.

webhooks.description: A list of urls to be notified when the run starts, updates, and completes.

id.description: The id of the callback.

url.description: The url to send the callback to. This will include a token for authentication.

token.description: The token to use to send the callback.

requestSchema.description: The JSON schema that the request matches.

request.description: The prompt of the callback (i.e. what to show the user).

examples.ask: What do you want to achieve today?

responseSchema.description: The JSON schema that the response should match.

callbacks.description: A list of urls to send the callback responses to.

streamToken.description: The token to use to stream the run.

errors.description: A list of errors that occurred during the run.

self.description: The url of the run. Use this to poll for updates.

stream.description: The url of the run. Use this to stream the run.

post.summary: Submit a callback for a run

schema.description: The token to submit the callback.

parameters.description: The token to submit the callback.
parameters.name: token

id.description: The id of the run.

version.description: The version of the app that was run. When using a semver range or 'latest', this will be the highest version that matches the range.

status.description: The status of the run.

url.description: The url to send the webhook to.

webhooks.description: A list of urls to be notified when the run starts, updates, and completes.

id.description: The id of the callback.

url.description: The url to send the callback to. This will include a token for authentication.

token.description: The token to use to send the callback.

requestSchema.description: The JSON schema that the request matches.

request.description: The prompt of the callback (i.e. what to show the user).

examples.ask: What do you want to achieve today?

responseSchema.description: The JSON schema that the response should match.

callbacks.description: A list of urls to send the callback responses to.

streamToken.description: The token to use to stream the run.

errors.description: A list of errors that occurred during the run.

self.description: The url of the run. Use this to poll for updates.

stream.description: The url of the run. Use this to stream the run.
